The Lord of the Rings Online

wikitext.*:
[[File:The Lord of the Rings Online - Grey Wood.jpg|thumb|250px|The Grey Wood in ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'']]
The '''Grey Wood''' was a wood growing between [[Mount Mindolluin]] in [[Gondor]] and the beacon-hill of [[Amon Dîn]] to the north. It formed an easterly outlier of the larger [[Drúadan Forest]], where the remnant of the [[Drúedain]] dwelt in the [[Third Age]].<ref>{{RK|Map}}</ref> Its trees masked the eastern entrance to the ancient and forgotten [[Stonewain Valley]] through the [[White Mountains]] near the [[Great West Road]].<ref name=Ride>{{RK|Ride}}</ref>

During the [[War of the Ring]], the Drúedain shared their knowledge of the secret Valley with the [[Rohirrim]], and so on [[14 March]]<ref>{{App|Great}}</ref> [[Théoden]] and his Men passed through the Grey Wood to the relief of [[Minas Tirith]].<ref name=Ride/> After the War, [[Aragorn]] returned to the Grey Wood, and it was here that he granted [[Ghân-buri-Ghân]] and his people the freedom of the whole Drúadan Forest.<ref>{{RK|Partings}}</ref>

==Portrayal in adaptations==
'''2016: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'':'''
:The Grey Wood is named so for the color of tree trunks: the forest is completely dead in this place, and the Drúedain no longer go there.
